parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Her own, his own, their own, themselves, they. Contracted for heautou; self.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To live luxuriously, revel, riot. From a presumed derivative of strenos; to be luxurious.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
Torture, torment. From basanizo; torture.
And, even, also, namely.
Mourning, sorrow, sadness, grief. Strengthened from the alternate of pascho; grief.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
A queen. Feminine from basileuo; a queen.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Mourning, sorrow, sadness, grief. Strengthened from the alternate of pascho; grief.
